reasoning='Step-by-step sizing of the underwater glider:

1. Mission geometry
   • The vehicle must descend 400 m and return, tracing two identical glide legs (down & up).
   • Required horizontal distance ≥ 4000 m ⇒ each leg must deliver ≥ 2000 m of horizontal travel.
   • For a constant glide angle θ (measured from horizontal):  horizontal distance per leg =  depth / tanθ.
   • Using θ = 10° → horizontal per leg = 400 m / tan10° ≈ 2268 m (> 2000 m).  Total horizontal = 2×2268 ≈ 4536 m ≥ 4000 m.
   • Path length per leg = depth / sinθ = 400 / sin10° ≈ 2304 m ⇒ total path length ≈ 4608 m.

2. Time check
   • Average glide speed = 1 m s⁻¹ (given).
   • Total time = 4608 m / 1 m s⁻¹ = 4608 s ≈ 1.28 h < 2 h (constraint satisfied).

3. Mass and volume
   • Choose total (ballast) mass m = 250 kg (≥ 200 kg).
   • To guarantee positive buoyancy when the pump removes water:  ρ_vehicle = m / V ≤ ρ_water = 1025 kg m⁻³.
   • Selecting V = 0.30 m³ gives ρ_vehicle = 250 / 0.30 ≈ 833 kg m⁻³ < 1025 kg m⁻³.
   • Volume range 0.2–1 m³ is met.

4. Power model
   • P(z) = P₀ + l·m + k·z with P₀ = 100 W, l = 0.05 W kg⁻¹, k = 0.2 W m⁻¹.
   • Constant term: P₀ + l·m = 100 W + 0.05×250 kg = 112.5 W.

5. Energy for one leg (descent)
   • Vertical speed v_z = depth / time_leg = 400 m / 2304 s ≈ 0.17365 m s⁻¹ (constant).
   • Energy = ∫₀^{400} (P₀ + l·m + k·z) (dz / v_z)
              = (1 / v_z) [ (112.5 W)·z + 0.5·k·z² ]₀^{400}
              = (1 / 0.17365) [ 112.5×400 + 0.5×0.2×400² ]
              ≈ 351 412 J ≈ 97.6 Wh.
   • Ascent leg is identical ⇒ total mission energy ≈ 2×97.6 Wh = 195.2 Wh.

6. Battery check
   • Required battery ≤ 195.2 Wh, below the 200 Wh maximum ⇒ satisfied.

7. Summary of chosen parameters
   • Glide angle θ = 10°
   • Vehicle volume V = 0.30 m³
   • Ballast / total mass m = 250 kg
   All mission, energy, buoyancy, size and mass constraints are met with comfortable margins.' config=ConfigFile(angle=10.0, volume=0.3, mass=250.0)
